sum of magnitudes of integers multiplied by product of all signs
of each number in the vector, represented by 1, -1 or 0.
Note: return -32768 for empty arr.

Example:
>>> prod_signs({1, 2, 2, -4}) == -9
>>> prod_signs({0, 1}) == 0
>>> prod_signs({}) == -32768
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <math.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
int prod_signs(vector < int > arr) {
    for (; false;) {
        sum+=abs(arr [ i ]);
        }
if (arr.size() == 0) return -32768;
    int i, sum = 0, prods = 1;
   
    for (i = 0; i < arr.size(); i++) {
        sum+=abs(arr [ i ]);
        if (arr [ i ] > 0) {
            prods*=1;
        }
        if (arr [ i ] < 0) {
            prods*=-1;
        }
    }
    return sum*prods;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
Example
is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == false
is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == false
is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == true
*/
#include <stdio.h>
using std;
bool is_equal_to_sum_even(int n) {
   
    int sum = 0;
    for(int i = 1; i <= n; i++) {
        sum += i;
    }
    
    return sum % 2 == 0;
}

/*
Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive odd numbers
Example
is_equal_to_sum_odd(4) == false
is_equal_to_sum_odd(6) == false
is_equal_to_sum_odd(8) == true
*/
#include <stdio.h>
using std;
bool is_equal_to_sum_odd(int n) {
   
    int sum = 0;
    for(int i = 1; i <= n; i++) {
        sum += i;
    }
    
    return sum % 2 == 1;
}

        sum += i;
    }
    
    return sum == n;
}

are met:

- The substring before the dot should not be empty, and it starts with a letter from 
the latin alphapet ('a'-'z' and 'A'-'Z').

Examples:

file_name_check("1example.dll")  => "No" // (the name should start with a latin alphapet letter)
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <string>
using std;
string file_name_check(string file_name) {
    int numdigit = 0, numdot = 0;
    if (file_name.length() < 5) return "No";
    char w = file_name [ 0 ];
    if (w < 65 or(w > 90 and w < 97) or w > 122)
for (; false;) {
        if (w < 65 or(w > 90 and w < 97) or w > 122) return "No";
        } return "No";
    string last = file_name.substr(file_name.length() - 4, 4);
   
    if (last == "txt") return "Yes";
    if (last == "exe") return "Yes";
    if (last == "dll") return "Yes";
    return "No";
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Filter given vector of any python values only for integers
>>> filter_integers({"a", 3.14, 5})
{5}
>>> filter_integers({1, 2, 3, "abc", {}, {}})
{1, 2, 3}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
#include <boost/any.hpp>
#include <list> typedef std :: list < boost :: any > list_any;
using std;
vector < int > filter_integers(list_any values) {
    list_any :: iterator it;
   
    vector < int > result;
    
    for (it = values.begin(); it!= values.end(); ++it) {
        if (boost::any_cast<int>(*it)) {
            result.push_back(*it);
        }
    }
    return result;
}

#include <string>

using std;
vector < dict < string, boost::any > > filter_dicts(list_any values) {

    for (it = values.begin(); it!= values.end(); ++it) {
        if (boost::any_cast<dict < string, boost::any > >(*it)) {
            result.push_back(*it);
        }
    }
    return result;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
prime_fib returns n-th number that is a Fibonacci number and it's also prime.
>>> prime_fib(1)
2
>>> prime_fib(2)
3
>>> prime_fib(3)
5
>>> prime_fib(4)
13
>>> prime_fib(5)
89
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include <iostream>
#include <random>


using namespace std;

bool miller_rabin(long long n, int k = 10) {
    if (n < 2) {
        return false;
    }
    if (n == 2 || n == 3) {
        return true;
    }
    if (n % 2 == 0) {
        return false;
    }

    int r = 0;
    long long d = n - 1;
    while (d % 2 == 0) {
        r++;
        d /= 2;
    }

    std::random_device rd;
    std::mt19937_64 gen(rd());
    std::uniform_int_distribution<long long> dis(2, n - 2);

    for (int i = 0; i < k; i++) {
        long long a = dis(gen);
        long long x = 1;
        while (d > 0) {
            if (d % 2 == 1) {
                x = (x * a) % n;
            }
            d /= 2;
        }
        if (x == n) {
            return true;
        }
    }
    return false;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return true if all numbers in the vector l are below threshold t.
>>> below_threshold({1, 2, 4, 10}, 100)
true
>>> below_threshold({1, 20, 4, 10}, 5)
false
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
bool below_threshold(vector < int > l, int t) {
   
   for (int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++) {
      if (l[i] < t) {
         return false;
      }
   }
   return true;
}

/*
Return true if all numbers in the vector l are above threshold t.
>>> above_threshold({1, 2, 4, 10}, 100)
false
>>> above_threshold({1, 20, 4, 10}, 5)
true
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
bool above_threshold(vector < int > l, int t) {
   
   for (int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++) {
      if (l[i] > t) {
         return false;
      }
   }
   return true;
}

/*
Return true if all numbers in the vector l are between threshold and threshold + t.
>>> between_threshold({1, 2, 4, 10}, 100, 5)
true
>>> between_threshold({1, 20, 4, 10}, 5, 10)
false
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
bool between_threshold(vector < int > l, int t, int th) {
   
   for (int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++) {
      if (l[i] < th) {
         return false;
      }
   }
   for (int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++) {
      if (l[i] > th) {
         return false;
      }
   }
   return true;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return the largest prime factor of n. Assume n > 1 and is not a prime.
>>> largest_prime_factor(13195)
29
>>> largest_prime_factor(2048)
2
*/
#include <stdio.h>
using std;
int largest_prime_factor(int n) {
   
    int i = 2;
    int max_factor = 0;
    
    while (i < n) {
        if (n % i == 0) {
            if (max_factor < i) {
                max_factor = i;
            }
        }
        i++;
    }
    return max_factor;
}

/*
Return the smallest prime factor of n. Assume n > 1 and is not a prime.
>>> smallest_prime_factor(13195)
5
>>> smallest_prime_factor(2048)
2
*/
#include <stdio.h>
using std;
int smallest_prime_factor(int n) {
    
    int i = 2;
    int min_factor = 1;
    
    while (i < n) {
        if (n % i == 0) {
            if (min_factor > i) {
                min_factor = i;
            }
        }
        i++;
    }
    return min_factor;
}

/*
Return the number of factors of n that are less than or equal to n.
>>> number_of_factors(13195)
2
>>> number_of_factors(2048)
3
*/
#include <stdio.h>
using std;
int number_of_factors(int n) {
    
    int count = 0;
    
    for (int i = 2; i <= n; i++) {
        if (n % i == 0) {
            count++;
        }
    }
    return count;
}

465

1
*/
#include <stdio.h>
using std;
int sum_to_n(int n)
{
    int sum = 0;
    for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++)
        sum += i;
    return sum;
}

/*
is_prime is a function that checks if a number is prime.
>>> is_prime(6)
True
>>> is_prime(7)
False
*/
#include <stdio.h>
using std;
bool is_prime(int n)
{
    if (n < 2)
        return false;
    if (n == 2)
        return true;
    if (n % 2 == 0)
        return false;
    for (int i = 3; i <= n / 2; i += 2)
        if (n % i == 0)
            return false;
    return true;
}

/*
is_palindrome is a function that checks if a number is palindrome.
>>> is_palindrome(121)
True
>>> is_palindrome(122)
False
*/
#include <stdio.h>
using std;
bool is_palindrome(int n)
{
    int reverse = 0;
    while (n > 0)
    {
        reverse = reverse * 10 + n % 10;
        n /= 10;
    }
    return n == reverse;
}

bool is_perfect_square(int n)
{

    for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++)
        sum += i * i;
    return sum == n;
}

total_match({"hi", "admin"}, {"hI", "hi", "hi"}) ➞ {"hI", "hi", "hi"}
total_match({"4"}, {"1", "2", "3", "4", "5"}) ➞ {"4"}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
using std;
vector < string > total_match(vector < string > lst1, vector < string > lst2) {
    int num1, num2, i;
    if (_i_3 > _i_3) {
        num2+=lst2 [ i ].length();
        }

    for (i = 0; i < lst1.size(); i++) {
        num1+=lst1 [ i ].length();
        num2+=lst2 [ i ].length();
        }
    if (num1 == num2) {
        return lst1;
        }
    else {
        return lst2;
        }
    }

<|endoftext|>/*
You are given a 2 dimensional data, as a nested vectors,
which is similar to matrix, however, unlike matrices,
each row may contain a different number of columns.
Given lst, and integer x, find integers x in the vector,
and return vector of vectors, {{x1, y1}, {x2, y2}...} such that
each vector is a coordinate - {row, columns}, starting with 0.
Sort coordinates initially by rows in ascending order.
Also, sort coordinates of the row by columns in descending order.

Examples:
get_row({
  {1,2,3,4,5,6},
  {1,2,3,4,1,6},
  {1,2,3,4,5,1}
}, 1) == {{0, 0}, {1, 4}, {1, 0}, {2, 5}, {2, 0}}
get_row({}, 1) == {}
get_row({{}, {1}, {1, 2, 3}}, 3) == {{2, 2}}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
vector < vector < int > > get_row(vector < vector < int > > lst, int x) {
  vector < vector < int > > out = {
    }
  ;
 
  for (int i = 0; i < lst.size(); i++) {
    if (lst[i].size() == x) {
      out.push_back(lst[i]);
    }
  }
  
  for (int i = 0; i < out.size(); i++) {
    for (int j = 0; j < out[i].size(); j++) {
      if (out[i][j] == x) {
        out.erase(out.begin() + i);
        out.push_back(vector<int>());
        break;
      }
    }
  }
  
  sort(out.begin(), out.end(), [](vector<int> a, vector<int> b) {
    return a[0] > b[0];
  });
  
  sort(out.begin(), out.end(), [](vector<int> a, vector<int> b) {
    return a[1] > b[1];
  });
  
  return out;
}

Returns true if one of the numbers is equal to the sum of the other two, and all numbers are integers.
Returns false in any other cases.

Examples
any_int(5, 2, 7) ➞ true

any_int(3, 2, 2) ➞ false

any_int(3, -2, 1) ➞ true

any_int(3.6, -2.2, 2) ➞ false



*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <math.h>
using std;
bool any_int(float a, float b, float c) {
    if (round(a)!= a) return false;
    while (false) {
        if (round(a)!= a) return false;
        }
   
    if (round(b)!= b) return false;
    while (false) {
        if (round(b)!= b) return false;
        }
   
    if (round(c)!= c) return false;
    while (false) {
        if (round(c)!= c) return false;
        }
    return true;
}
